content.description:
Shortly after starting the climb work your way around the overhand for a 5.9 climb or directly over the top to spice things up and bump the rating to a 5.10c/d. Shares anchor with Gneiss Schist

Start in the middle of the wall below a obvious ledge.
Two hangars with rings at top. 9 bolts.

Shares anchor with the trad variation of Insomnia.

Start just to the left of a vertical outcrop just right of center of wall.
Two hangars with rings at top. 7 bolts.

Fun climb with many good holds the whole way up. Shares the first bolt with Hatchet Man. Put up by JD and JB

Second bolted climb to climbers left of a fairly prominent overhanging arete. Shares the same starting hangar as Hatchet Man
Two hangars with rings at top. 9 bolts.

Shares anchor with 59 Tomahawks.

Start near the middle of the wall to the right of an obvious bulge.
Two hangars with rings at top. 8 bolts.

Good positive holds up interesting rock until you reach a balancy crux 2/3 of the way up. Can be top roped but the anchors are a bit farther away from the top of the wall then one may feel comfortable with just scrambling to. Consider setting up a rappel off a sturdy tree or something. Put up by JD, JB, and GW.

Furthest bolted route to climbers left of the wall
Two hangars with rings at top. Bolted.

One of two mixed climbs at this crag. Shares the first bolt with Fairway. Put up in 2017 by JD and CR. Start near the middle of the wall just to the left of a small overhang. Two hangars with rings at top. Mixed climb with gear to 3".

***NOTE***
As of May 2019 one hangar still needs to be fixed to a stud on this route

Start with positive holds up to a slightly overhung section and finish with some nice easy face climbing. Shares hangars with Insomnia.  Fun, gym-style climbing.  Avoid the left side of the route, there is some loose rock and debris.  Watch out for rope drag on any falls with swing to the side if top roping.


Start at the far right of the wall just to the left of the obvious overhung bulge.

Two hangers with rings at top. 5 bolts.

A tough start for shorter climbers. Sustained. Shares anchors with The Horn.

Start right of a vertical bulge in the rock below a V shaped crack.
Two hangars with rings at top. 7 bolts.

Use the first 2 bolts of Insomnia but trend left into a short but pumpy slightly overhanging crack. Shares anchor with Dinner With In-Laws.

Start right of a vertical bulge in the rock below a V shaped crack.
Two hangars with rings at top. 2 bolts, gear to 2.5".

The newest rout on this wall and short but sweet. Consistently pumpy climbing with decent holds throughout (if you can find them) Keep left to avoid fractured rock. This is a new climb and grade is open to interpretation. The last climb on the right of the wall up and over an overhung section.  Two hangars with NO rings at top (June 2019). 4 bolts.
  • *One could use the bottom most bolt as a belay station as footing is poor below but this leaves you vulnerable to getting hit if the climber fails to clip the bolt above the bulge.**

Found in between and above Green Manaleshe and Fantastic Four. A great crag with lots of 5.8/5.9 climbing packed in to one area. Over the winter of 2018/2019 a couple trees at the foot of the climbs blew down leaving the ledge feeling slightly exposed. Fixed lines and lots of hangers exist to keep you and your gear safe from a tumble. It's been a group effort to develop this crag by several people, most notably one John Dyck.
